alert.note: Alert for Childress; Cottle; Dickens; Hall; Kent; King; Motley; Stonewall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 10 at 1:35PM CDT until April 10 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE ROLLING PLAINS AND EXTREME SOUTHEASTERN TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE ROLLING PLAINS AND EXTREME SOUTHEASTERN TEXAS PANHANDLE... * Timing...Until 10 PM Sunday. * Wind...Westerly at 20 to 25 mph at the 20 foot level with gusts to 35 mph. * Humidity...As low as 5 percent. * Fuels...Extremely dry. * Impacts...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged. Conditions could be particularly dangerous on Tuesday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are imminent or already occurring. These conditions can create rapid wildfire growth. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Monitor later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Childress; Cottle; Dickens; Hall; Kent; King; Motley; Stonewall
